rComments: Lieber's career at UCSC is a testament to our department's absolute inability to produce intellectuals. If you want to slide through a class for a GE, please don't attend his courses, you're wasting everyone's time. Lieber is a brilliant professor and great at teaching, if you can be receptive. I'm glad he's leaving: he deserves so much better!
Hard to understand.... very strange but is passionate about his subject.

Jeffrey is extremely knowledgeable and interesting to listen to. He has a soothing voice that can either put you to sleep or make the class more interesting. I read most of the readings, but later realized you only need to read the material to help you for the two essays that are given. There was no midterm, and the final was relatively easy.

Most engaging lecturer I've ever had. He is insanely knowledgeable about many subjects, which he magically relates to architecture, and the lectures are very absorbing. I had almost no interest in architecture before taking this class, and now I love it. There is a lot of dense readings, but most of it is fascinating. Highly, highly recommended!!!

This introduction to architecture was totally enlightening. Jeffrey is extremely knowledgeable and is a very engaging lecturer. The overall course load was pretty heavy but I learned SO MUCH. I would definitely recommend this class for those who can bring a sincere interest!

Prof. Lieber is a genius. Although this class was very heavy on reading, his lectures were always interesting and engaging. The connections he made between architecture and culture, politics, etc. were fascinating. I would strongly recommend taking any class with him, even if you aren't currently interested in Architecture.
